acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 48-hour EC50>500mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (IUCLID, 2000).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 5 from rat LD50 : 2100mg/kg (RTECS (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale:
Since data is insufficient, it cannot be classified.
(Since there is data that 4/6-animal death with 8000ppm/4H exposure in rat test, it is presumed to be Category 5)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 2140 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: ACGIH (2001)

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be harmful if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: We have a statement that the aspiration into the lungs may occure the chemical pneumonia (HSDB (2005)), and we classified it as Category 2 as it being ketone with the carbon numbers 5.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data and reports

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility =48100 mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: It is the liquid with ignition points of 452 degC (ICSC (1996)) and it does not ignite in room temperatures.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Although there is a report of having no influence in the mouse reproduction studies  (IUCLID (2000)), it cannot be classified due to insufficient data.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: As there is no data, it cannot be classified.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2A from the moderate by the examination of the rabbit (ACGIH (2001)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evaluation of Mild in the examination on rabbits (ACGIH (2001)), it was classified as Category 3. .

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the negative result of a test in humans (IUCLI (2000)), it was put outside of Category.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There is only a report of the drinking water administration examination outside the guidance value of Category 2. It cannot be classified due to insufficient data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (central nervous system),
Category 3 (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
May cause respiratory irritation (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: By inhalation exposure, a coma (PATTY (5th, 2001)), a coma, giddiness, headache, malfunction, and depression of the central nervous system are caused (HSDB (2005)), si it was set as category 1 (central nervous system)), and it segmented into Category 3 (anaesthetic). And from the statement of respiratory irritation (ICSC (1996), HSDB (2005), ACGIH (2001)), it was set as category 3 (respiratory irritation).
